titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Mrs. Humphry Ward Collection
titlestmt.author: by Diane J. Ducharme

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday November 30, 2018 at 04:10
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

did.unittitle: Mrs. Humphry Ward collection

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of miscellaneous letters by Mrs. Humphry Ward and writings, including holographs of The Marriage of William Ashe and A Writer's Recollections.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ongoing collection of documents acquired by gift and purchase from various sources.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Mrs. Humphry Ward Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Mrs. Humphry Ward Collection. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This listing encompasses accessions of single manuscripts and small groups of manuscripts pertaining to Mrs. Humphry Ward acquired by gift or purchase from various sources by the Beinecke Library. Materials acquired prior to January 1995 have been arranged in two series. Series I, Letters, consists of letters by Mrs. Humphry Ward and is alphabetically arranged by recipient. Series II, Writings, contains writings by Mrs. Ward and is arranged alphabetically by title. Materials acquired after January 1995 are located in Series III, Additions since January 1995, and are listed in accession order.
This register is updated periodically. For information on material added to the collection since the last update, please consult the Public Services desk.

did.unittitle: Letters
Letter : to Mr. Bridgeman

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 item (2 leaves) ; 18 cm. ALS. Removed from copy of Marie Clothilde Balfour's From Saranac to the Marquesas and Beyond .

did.unittitle: Letters to Mr. and Mrs. Capper

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 items. 2 ALS, one (1904 Jan 22) concerning her 'Heresy Trial' letter and Mr. Beeby's resignation. Purchased in 1990.

did.unittitle: Writings
" Helbeck of Bannisdale : Book II, Chapter 4. (The last chapter)," holograph, corrected

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 v. (43 l.) ; 21 cm. Inscribed: "I give this original MS of the last chapter of Helbeck of Bannisdale to the Red Cross Sale 1917. Mary A. Ward." Bound in: ALS from George Meredith thanking Ward for sending him Helbeck of Bannisdale , (2 leaves), 1898 Aug 30. Purchased in 1989.

did.unittitle: Holograph, corrected

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 item (ca. 590 leaves) ; 21 cm. and smaller. Original title: "Ashley's Marriage." Purchased in 1989.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 item [ca. 750-800 leaves] ; various sizes. Chapters 1-5 fragmentary; 6-23 more complete; 24 in page proof only.

did.unittitle: Photograph : Portrait of Mrs. Humphry Ward
Letter: Stocks, Tring., to W. Alexander

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 item (2 L) ; 18 cm. LS (body of letter in third-party hand) concerning Mr. Bok's interview. Signed: "Mary A. Ward." With: envelope. Purchased in 1999.

did.unittitle: Letter: Stocks, Tring., to Arthur Wagg

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 item (3 L.) ; 20 cm. ALS concerning Wagg's contribution to the Evening Play Center Fund and her work on their behalf. Tipped onto half sheet of stiff paper. Purchased in 1999.

did.unittitle: Letter: Stocks, Tring., to Mr. [Vincent] Baddeley

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 item (2 L.) ; 18 cm. ALS concerning seats for George V's coronation and the naval review. With: explanatory ANS by Baddeley and a transcript. Purchased in 1999.

did.unittitle: Letter : 25, Grosvenor Place, to Messrs. Harper

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 item (6 L.) ; 18 cm. ALS headed "Private" concerning the forthcoming serial publication of Eleanor , including corrections to the illustrations; also arguing against publication of the novel in 2 volumes in America. Purchased in 2001.

did.unittitle: Fenwick's Career : holograph, draft, with revisions and corrected page proof inserted throughout

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 item (ca. 350 L) ; various sizes Chapters I-XIV represented. Purchased in 2001.

did.unittitle: Letters to Lady Mirrielees

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 4 items. 4 ALS to Lady Mirrielees concerning the charitable work done by the British St. Centre for children, inviting her to visit an exhibition of the children's handicrafts, and thanking her for a contribution. Purchased in 2002.

did.unittitle: Letter : 61 Russell Square, to "Sir"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 item ; 17 cm. ALS insisting that she "did not wish her photograph to be sold to the trade." Annotated in another hand: "Mrs. Ward blows hot and cold... would you write her direct without allusion to me?" Purchased in 2002.

did.unittitle: Letters : 25, Grosvenor Place to Mrs. Hugh Smith

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 items. 2 ALS concerning invitations and visits. Accompanied by typed transcript of 1895 Jun 27 letter. Purchased in 2002.
